result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M. Stahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay fine of $200  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.   
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
May not have contact with Joshua Crouch or Theresa Burns.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa M. Stahl

records.addlTxt:
Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:16am-  Matter heard with 13CF481.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions - concurrent to 13CF481.  Court orders $200.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.
from P&P Agent Christina Nolan    (Copy given to ADA & Attorney Caspari on 9/4/2014)

ADDRESS INFO for Lisa M. Stahl
Current: 8067  Sheridan Road, Lot 37, Kenosha, WI 53143 United States  (Effective: 08-15-2014)
Prior: 9848 Lakeshore Drive, Pleasant Prairie, WI 53158 
Notice of Hearing returned.  New address entered.  Resent.
Sentencing hearing on September 4, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Due to a conflict w/ the court's calendar, 8/15/2014 Sentencing hearing is rescheduled to 9/4/2014 at 11am.  Attorney Caspari did not respond to the clerk's email re: rescheduling.  NTBS by the Court.

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:53am-  Matter heard with 13CF481.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:27am-  Matter heard with 13CF481.  Matter is resolved.  Court will not take a plea today as the plea offer states the DE would stipulate to restitution in 13CF481 & a restitution request has not been made.  Plea hearing adjourned to June 18, 2014 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:52am-  Matter heard with 13CF481.  DE has received a global offer from the State.  Attorney Caspari is requesting matter be set for a plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Diane Caspari. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 5-9-14 @ 10:30am with 13CF481. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
